intro: Fagraea suaveolens, commonly known as the fragrant evergreen or sweet-scented fagraea, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and pleasant aroma.
